title: Difficult Diagnosis Discussion
description: Breaking bad news about a chronic condition diagnosis
context: A 35-year-old patient has come in for follow-up after recent tests. You need to inform them that they have been diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes. The patient is a busy professional with two young children and has no family history of diabetes. They seemed healthy and are likely to be shocked by this news.
patient_type: Young adult, busy lifestyle, unexpected diagnosis
key_points: Use a gentle, clear approach to break the news
Allow time for the information to sink in
Discuss treatment options and lifestyle changes
Emphasize that it's manageable with proper care
